thread.title: Union chief: 2 federal officers assaulted by inmates at...
thread.title_full: Union chief: 2 federal officers assaulted by inmates at... | www.ajc.com

author: David Wickert
title: Union chief: 2 federal officers assaulted by inmates at...
text:
Two correctional officers were injured in an assault by inmates at the U.S. Penitentiary in Atlanta Saturday morning, according to a union official.
Vance Bryant, local president of the Council of Prison Locals union, said two inmates assaulted the two officers shortly after 6 a.m. In a news release, he said they were in a pretrial/holdover housing unit when the incident occurred.
Bryant said the inmates were sprayed with pepper spray but continued to assault the officers. Other staff members arrived and helped restrain the inmates, he said.
It was unclear how seriously the officers were injured. Bryant said two other staff members received minor injuries during the incident. He said the prison was placed on limited operational status, and the FBI was notified of the incident.
Officials with the prison and the Federal Bureau of Prisons public affairs office did not immediately respond to inquiries Saturday.
The U.S. Penitentiary in Atlanta is located at 601 McDonough Blvd. SE, about two miles south of Zoo Atlanta. It houses about 2,430 male prisoners.
